dogs.name: Boxer
dogs.comments: This German breed is of the medium-sized molossus type, and was used in the World Wars to send messages, collect bodies of wounded soldiers, or carry communication cables.

dogs.name: Spanish Mastiff
dogs.features: devoted to her owners and an effective nanny
dogs.size: large size, is muscular and powerful
dogs.comments: It is one of the European dog breeds very present in rural areas, and is used as a guardian of cattle.

dogs.name: Dogue Bordeaux
dogs.features: Caring, attached to his family, faithful and quiet.
dogs.comments: These big guys may seem calm, but show them a turret or cannon and you'll see their fury unleashed! Slow yet durable, these warriors are best used to soak up hits.

dogs.name: Goblin
dogs.comments: These pesky little creatures only have eyes for one thing: LOOT! They are faster than a Spring Trap, and their hunger for resources is limitless.

dogs.name: Wall Breaker
dogs.comments: Nothing warms a Wall Breaker's cold and undead heart like blowing up walls. A squad of them will make way for your ground units, and they will do it with a BANG!

dogs.name: Balloon
dogs.comments: These promoted skeletons have traded in their joy of destroying walls for a joy of destroying defenses. Deploy them to take out pesky mortars and cannons!

dogs.name: Wizard
dogs.comments: The Wizard is a terrifying presence on the battlefield. Pair him up with some of his fellows and cast concentrated blasts of destruction on anything, land or sky!

dogs.name: Healer
dogs.comments: This majestic creature lives to protect and aid her fellow troops. Any army is improved with her healing support, but make sure to protect her from air defenses!

dogs.name: Dragon
dogs.comments: The might of the dragons are known throughout the land. This scaly terror of the skies feels no mercy and nothing will escape the fiery splashes of his breath.

dogs.name: P.E.K.K.A
dogs.comments: Is P.E.K.K.A a knight? A samurai? A robot? No one knows! P.E.K.K.A's armor absorbs even the mightiest of blows.

dogs.name: Baby Dragon
dogs.comments: This fire-breathing hatchling is shy around other air units, but leave it alone and it will throw a fit! When not around other air units, Baby Dragons become enraged and gain bonus damage and attack speed.

dogs.name: Miner
dogs.comments: These sneaky shovelers burrow underground, pass beneath walls, and pop up right next to their targets. While underground, Miners cannot be damaged and will not trigger traps, but still gain bonuses from Spells.

dogs.name: Electro Dragon
dogs.comments: Possessing iron-tough scales and a breath of devastating lightning, the Electro Dragon's favorite thing is raining destruction from above. When vanquished, the Electro Dragon even pummels the ground with lightning strikes!

dogs.name: Yeti
dogs.comments: The heavy-hitting furry fellow digs cold weather and his Yetimite buddies. Hurt him, and you'll make the Yetimites real angry.

dogs.name: Dragon Rider
dogs.comments: This aerial engine of destruction readily and frankly, quite excitedly lays waste to any defense it comes across. The skeleton onboard swears he's not touching the controls.
